poem:
"Ode to the Silent Grove"

No bird's note sings at the dawn,
the creek's water has withdrawn. 
The maple stands with borrowed time,
in the absence of nature's chime.
Quiet now the loamy land,
bereft of the minstral's band. 
Man's echo loud in the hollow air,
a requiem of despair. 
A plea to heed, let the world unfold,
lest we inherit the silence we've sold.
